TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Spin/DownHorizontal extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the left-pointing arrow for a spin button control (also known as an up-down control). This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Spin.DownHorizontal class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the left-pointing arrow for a spin button.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Spin.DownHorizontal.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Spin_DownHorizontal1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#61](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_20_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#61](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_20_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Button_PushButton4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#64](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/33f1b1c8-05e1-4661-8e4e-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#64](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/33f1b1c8-05e1-4661-8e4e-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the hot state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.

Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Button_PushButton2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.

Docs.value: A that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the normal state.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the pressed state.
Docs.value: A that represents a left-pointing spin button arrow in the pressed state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Button_PushButton3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
